summary: Best Emoji pop up for Linux

description: Better than the alternatives on Linux
Simple interface and easy to use. Good to finally have a decent emoji picker than works in all apps. ?
App only shows a list of emojis which can't be picked. Needs more work.

I created this as there did not seem to be any other applications available that worked how I wanted.

This is a work in progress - please report any bugs to https://github.com/tom-james-watson/emote

FYI to poster saying emojis can't be picked - selecting an emoji only copies it to the clipboard.
Great job on the tool, easy to use and I can quickly grab needed emoji by searching

It has a much more sensibly copies the character you click, and gets out of the way. It takes 3-4 clicks in Gnome Characters to copy an emoji I want. This takes 1-2. Plus This runs in the background and easily comes up with a hotkey, whereas I have to manually open characters every time, unless I decide to leave it up taking up workspace... space
Good for writing emoji's. However automatically pasting the emoji to the last active window would be neat. Because pasting it by hand feels like an extra step.

Its easy to use, just ctrl+alt+e than the emoticon has copied to my clibboard.
I like it............. ???
Great tool for selecting Emoji's, makes using emoji's on Linux a lot simpler!

Could use a few tweaks, but very handy. Something like this should come with Ubuntu out of the box, but it's not that big of a deal. I like that I can change the trigger. Thank you developer for your work.
Works on every app just that! Wish more windows emoji picker like feature will arive in future.
summary: Hands down the best emoji app on linux

description: 6/5 ??? finally I found emoji picker that just works ?

summary: Awesome ? It works and can be executed via shortcut!

description: I was just feature proofing and then it hit me I still havent installed emojis
summary: just in the nick of time

description: Was looking for something simliar to the one windows has, this is it.

This app does exactly what I was looking for: it pops up a selection menu when one presses a keyboard shortcut, allowing to quickly select an emoji to insert into an arbitrary text field. Even better: the keyboard shortcut is customizable! Works like a charm, and I especially liked that the app configures itself automatically for launching in the background on startup.
Found every emoji so far, it remembers recently used emojis, the search works and the shortcut `Ctrl+Alt+E` is great. Thanks.
I usually use it for apps which don't have their emoji list.. this works well for me
This application looks good, but it won't launch

It works as expected: With shortcut (by default CTRL+Shift+E) changed to CTRL+Supr+E.
NOTE: I haven't checked it with Ubuntu 22.04 + Wayland (the default), as I had problems with other apps
Recomiendo a todos configurar el atajo con "Win + ."
comme indiqué, j'ai été ds clavier > raccourcis, et voilà ! ?
configure your shortcut, and enjoy selecting your emoji with keywords
